item.title: Practical information
item.description: Venue The RUSE symposium will take place on the University of Manchester’s Sackville Street Campus in the heart of Manchester city centre, just a 5-minute walk from Piccadilly train station or a 10-minute walk from Oxford Road station. Registration and fees Registration opens in June. Fees are as follows and include both days of the symposium, with a buffet lunch and refreshments throughout the day. We reserve a limited number of places for PhD students with a subsidized fee through a separate application procedure, details of which will be made available once registration opens.

item.title: Call for Papers
item.description: Different theories and models attribute linguistic variation and change to different causes. Currently, significant tension exists between approaches that explain variation and change in terms of a parametric approach to the structure of grammar and the language learner’s interaction with primary linguistic data, and approaches that instead derive variation and change from usage effects and the social embedding of language. The two-day long symposium is devoted to addressing this tension in an effort to arrive at a better understanding of the status quo of research on language variation and change, and to outline the most fruitful ways forward towards formal models that make quantitative, empirically testable predictions.
